page.title: 03Stansted Airport
page.content: With the long awaited decision on London's third airport to be made, every week saw a new report in the local paper either proclaiming the idea or stating how bad it would be for the towns. Now the choice has been made to expand this aerodrome from a half to eight million passengers per year both camps are assessing the situation. On the disadvantage side are the increase in noise levels, which are feared, and the steady build up of traffic on the already overcrowded roads. The plus side balances these two problems with the new bypass due to be constructed in the next four years and the increase in trade or house prices. Asking the inhabitants of the town brought a mixed response but the general attitude was to wait and see.
